comments.body:
Maybe as an Easter Egg to the game "Undertale", it could be the piano used in "Gaster's Theme", which would work well with the whole "Dark, Darker, Yet Darker" thing he has going on.
Link to the song: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=DzVLULTUc7o
Or maybe they don't disappear, but you will burn if you sit in them, so you still need fire rez just to survive using the boats in lava.

I think it can be logically justified. If logs and planks do not burn, but sticks, tools, bowls burn, then it turns out that some kind of fire-resistant juice simply disappears with a certain degree of cutting the log. I think we'll need a fire resistance potion/pants or a golden apple to keep from dying.
But they should be fire proof because the wood burns in lava but the blocks are fireproof
They shouldn't be fireproof, since that would make them an easy way to "replace striders", in Mojang's words.
Maybe you could craft mochi and cherry blossom tea from the flowers.
This would make the warden was easier than it is tanked as a battle tank ðŸ˜­
The warden should not drop anything useful!!! This has been said MANY TIMES. The warden shouldn't be killed!
actually the warden is considered a boss mob on pc so ..... that         anyways it is a good idea
Pillagers have to eat too
This should be in mobs not blocks, tools, and items

Maybe mending would have a chance to steal durability from other tools. It would prioritize the item with the highest durability. This means that to repair something while you have multiple items in you inventory, it would take extra long as there would randomly be items losing durability.

How about this: Some more enchantments are going to be tresure enchantments (like infinity and fire aspect)
These tresure enchantments are a possible trade on a maxed villager. It would make mending more expensive, you can't reset trades that often, etc.

^This

and netherite shulkers also hold normal shulkers

 

fix the inventory
Cool idea. I don't know about dungeons, but legendary weapons could be really cool.
This also applies to armor.
This would be awesome, but might be too much for devices to handle when using weird combat.
Minecraft music can be kinda sad though
Pretty good of an idea :)
No no no.
Please
Yes. Concrete is hard to get and I don't think it would have adverse effect on game. Instead it would unleash creativness. Good idea. (Although probably suggested already dozen times)..

Yes yes yes!
Stonecutter should work fine with all earthy rocky blocks!
This would be pretty cool! I think it would also be neat if they added more sound elements to the game overall so that it'd have more use outside of the ancient city :)

or you could make it an enchantment that prevents vibrations based on your experience, and echo shards could be used to get the experience required by being crafted into bottles of enchanting which wouldn't make vibrations when you're wearing the enchanted armour

Kingbdogz said he didn't want to add anything to minecraft that makes you invisible to the warden and undetectable to it so instead of that maybe it could give nearby enemies the darkness affected Making then unable to see you for brief moments and not attacking you
The helmet should also detect vibrations and sense how far they are. I think it should be 0.5 protection points than netherite armor.
The helmet should also detect vibrations and sense how far they are. I think it should be 0.5 protection points than netherite armor.

Why not use diamond instead? It wouldn't make you vibration-proof, either - that could be the purview of bringing back wool/"cloth" armor - but it would at the very least mask your scent from the Warden making it more viable to sneak around when the Warden is close by. Similar to how standard piglins smell your gold armor and think you're one of them, so long as you're not making too many vibrations when sneaking around (keep your hands off those chests!), the Warden would think you're part of the surrounding environment and leave you alone, at least until you stop sneaking or do something that makes noise regardless of sneaking.

And let's face it, this would give Echo Shards a viable use in Hardcore worlds, along with another user's suggestion above of using them for Bottles o' Enchanting. Perhaps a name for this armor could be "Skulked" Armor, and it would be an armor-only tier similar to leather and chainmail, as tools wouldn't be very viable in any similar function. (And before someone mentions quietly mining in the Deep Dark: Sculk does not mask vibrations. That's what wool is for. Perhaps cover them with "cloth" instead at the cost of efficiency.)

Being able to not make vibrations would be overpowered. Nothing says that you won't ever go back to an ancient city after getting echo shards. There's more there than the shards. If it were to exist, it shouldn't be as good as netherite. That would be unbalanced, having high protection and make no vibrations. It should be more around the level of iron or lower.
Cool! This could also maybe allow you to walk on magma blocks and fire without taking damage.
ah,, but,, the lava should not cause fall damage.
Obviously, the Frostwalker simply has to temporarily cool the lava to a state of magma.
That would be awesome please add this to the game Iâ€™ll still use the beloved striders in early game because it should be level 30

I love the idea so much! Maybe instead of Lava Walker making lava walkable, it could turn it into magma. This would mimic Frost Walker turning water to ice. Magma is hotter than lava, while ice is cooler than water. Additionally, because of how many boot enchantments there are maybe you could combine Lava Walker and Water Walker to make Liquid Walker!
It should be craftable too, but just being there is nice I guess
Mabey with the new frog mob as the symbol in the mud bricks
I think freezing should reduce attack speed.
it would freeze water too or it would work under water unlike fire aspect
When you hit somebody with this enchantment they must freeze

I love this idea!

I think that's a good idea, considering it's an eco-location mob.

It'd also be neat as an item to create raids. Don't know if anyone noticed but it kind of feels like scouts don't happen as much as they use to and sometimes outpost are a long way from bases and/or villages.
I'd say 5 to 10 seconds of distraction would make sense; that's a good while in game time. The distraction makes sense since the Warden is supposed to locate players by sound.

I will use my pickaxe when I forgot where to put my key.
I agree it would make a cool addition and it would make it harder to get through than an iron door because you can't just bring a lever or button
Yeah and make it so that you canâ€™t break it unless the key is in your inventory. (Otherwise it kinda defeats the purpose.)
im happy everyones trying to make copper usefull thanks ;)
There could be a skulk block that when you move it brings all other players and mobs closer to it but you stay still and you could use it for protecting your base

New sculk block ideas-
Rooted/malicious sculk: sculk that acts both like soul sand and honey to pull the player down and disable them from jumping. The texture could be sculk with bone fragments inside and/or pulsing blue veins/roots. If players stumble onto it with sculk surrounding them, it may force them to break sculk/make sound.
The silencer: Instead of needing to be triggered by sound like a shrieker, proximity near this block will disable players from using projectiles such as fireworks, enderpearls, snowballs, etc. The texture for this block could have a bone frame with a large black hole on each side of the block.
It would also be interesting/disturbing if one of these new blocks caused a nausea effect from mushing around in bone infested sculk.
Cool idea!
Yes pls love the idea :D

The telescope should allow you to look as far as simulation distance allows even if render distance is shorter.

When placed, the telescope faces N, S, E or W, and should be swivel-able up to 45 degrees in both X and Y axis, but otherwise is stationary.
yea adding 3 sticks to the recipe should let me place it on a tripod. great decoration!
